docs.title: This Site
docs.text: This is my main GitHub Page. The data are stored in my GitHub repository maroph/maroph.github.io.

docs.title: How I create the pages on this site
docs.text: My pages are written in Markdown (directory docs) an transformed into HTML pages (local directory site) with the MkDocs static site generator. The site data are published in the gh-pages branch of the directory.

docs.title: Python modules in use to produce this site:
docs.text:
• MkDocs
  • Material for MkDocs
  • MkDocs plugin mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin
  • MkDocs plugin mkdocs-macros-plugin

docs.title: Python Virtual Environment
docs.text: I use a virtual environment with the above Python modules.

docs.title: How the virtual environment is created
docs.text:
The following commands are used to build.bash the needed virtual environment:

$ python3 -m venv ./venv
$ source ./venv/bin/activate
$ python -m pip install --upgrade pip
$ python -m pip install --upgrade setuptools
$ python -m pip install --upgrade wheel
$ python -m pip install --upgrade mkdocs-material
$ python -m pip install --upgrade mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin
$ python -m pip install --upgrade mkdocs-macros-plugin

The current installed module versions are:

mkdocs==1.6.1
mkdocs-get-deps==0.2.0
mkdocs-git-revision-date-localized-plugin==1.4.5
mkdocs-macros-plugin==1.3.7
mkdocs-material==9.6.11
mkdocs-material-extensions==1.3.1

docs.title: Create the virtual environment with the build.bash script
docs.text:
$ ./build.bash venv
$ source ./venv/bin/activate

docs.title: Install missing Python3 software
docs.text:
If pip for Python3 and/or the Python3 venv module aren't installed on your system use the following commands as administrator (root):

$ sudo apt install python3-pip
$ sudo apt install python3-venv

docs.title: Build the docs
docs.text:
$ source venv/bin/activate
$ mkdocs build

or

$ source venv/bin/activate
$ ./build.bash

docs.title: Build the docs for testing

$ ./build.bash serve

docs.title: Build the docs for publishing
docs.text: The build step is done by the GitHub Actions file .github/workflows/ci.yml by every checkin in the branch main.

docs.title: Manually: MkDocs deploy
docs.text:
$ source venv/bin/activate
$ ./build.bash deploy

$ git commit -m "my commit message"
$ git push

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
This site is build with MkDocs. The theme in use is Material for MkDocs. Additional I use the plugin mkdocs-git-revision-date-plugin.

The intro picture (assets/THHGTTG_intro.jpg) at the home page is a renamed copy of the image https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/images/ic/480xn/p01td1v2.jpg. This image is a screenshot of the original "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy" Infocom game released in 1984.

You can play a modernized version of this game at the following BBC site The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy - 30th Anniversary Edition
